result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon S Topel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF64, 15CF66, and 15CF373 called together at 10:30am [mo]
Defendant Brandon S Topel in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1 and #3 of Case 15CF373 and Count #1 of Count 15CF66; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 of Case 15CF64, Counts #2 and #4 of Case 15CF373

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Topel 

On Counts #1 and #3 of Case 15CF373 and Count #1 of Count 15CF66, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--On Count #1 of Case 15CF66: to serve 100 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--the Defendant shall not possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--to submit DNA sample upon demand
--the Defendant shall not be present in any Wal-Mart stores
--the Defendants shall not be present in any bar, tavern, or liquor stores
--On Count #1 of Case 15CF373:to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3 of Case 15CF373:to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--On Count #1 of Case 15CF66:to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge


As to Case15CF64 : Days credit for time already served:  33  days
As to Cases 15CF373 and 15CF66: Days credit for time already served: 31 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibition Warnings given
recess: 11:11am
to Scheduling Order, State's (with cover letter)
to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications, State's
Conflict Review Worksheet - No Conflict Found

Cases 15CF64, 15CF66,15CF373 called together at 8:43am [mo]
Defendant Brandon S Topel in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

As to All Cases Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occurs:
Mr.Topel waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

As to Cases 15CF64 and 15CF66 Arraignment occurs:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--DEMAND FOR SPPEDY TRIAL IN BOTH CASES

As to Case 15CF373 Arraignment occurs:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--DEMAND FOR SPEEDY TRIAL

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Topel. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

recess: 9:06am

NEXT:   AS TO CASE 15CF64: (1)FSSC on 1/4/16 at 2:00pm (2)Jury Trial on 1/7 OR 1/8/15 at 8:30am ((time limits apply))
             AS TO CASE 15CF66: (1)FSSC on 1/11/16 at 11:00am (2) Jury Trial on 1/14/16 at 8:30am ((time limits apply))
             AS TO CASE 15CF373: (1)FSSC on 1/25/16 at 2:00pm (2) Jury Trial on 1/28/16 at 8:30am ((time limits apply))

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon S Topel
Current: 411 S Center Ave, c/o Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 11-09-2015)
Prior: 31 Madison Avenue, Milton, WI 53563 United States
Duplicate Original Warrant returned by JCSD

Cases 15CF64, 15CF66 & 15CF373 called at 1:37 pm  [sf] 
Defendant Brandon S Topel in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hageman from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Address and DOB information verified.

On Case15CF373:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500 CASH bond to cover all 3 cases, with conditions: 
--No presence at any Wal-Mart
--no contact with Nate Habeck or Alyssa Wutke 
--no presence at any Walmart
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today   

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.

Recess: 1:41 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 11/16/15 at 8:30 am

Cases 15CF65, 15CF64 & 15CF66 called together at 3:46 pm [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for preliminary hearing)
Defendant Alyssa A Wutke in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert (15CF65).  Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears on behalf of Defendant Brandon Topel (15CF64 & 15CF66). ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that Mr. Topel appeared to have car issues and could not appear today. Did anticipate would be waiving preliminary hearing in this matter
ADA Shock informs the Court that before matter started, was informed by Deputy that Mr. Topel has active warrant in Dodge County, requests warrants in each of Mr. Topel's cases scheduled today
Upon questioning of the Court, Counsel indicate they are unsure what the active warrant is for
Deputy Kanters who is present in the gallery indicates that the warrant is for contempt of court, failure to pay attorney fees
ADA Shock informs the Court that there are witnesses present on case 15CF66
Court orders issuance of bench warrant in each of Mr. Topel's cases - Body Only
Recess: 3:54 pm as to cases 15CF64 & 15CF66
Received a call from the defendant at 2:03 pm that his car has broken down//he will not be able to make it to court today at 3PM//he also left a message for his attorney
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
This Bond applies to both Cases #15CF64 and #15CF66

[MK] cases #15CF64 and #15CF66 called at 1:55pm. 
Defendant Brandon S. Topel appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

As to both cases:  
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Mr. Topel verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaints is current and he provides a new address of:  31 Madison Avenue, Milton WI 53563.
The Court sets both cases for Preliminary Hearing on May 26th when the Case #15CF64 Do-Defendant's case is already scheduled.

The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond which applies to both cases, with conditions:
--no contact with Nate Habeck or Alyssa Wutke
--no presence at any Walmart
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today 
recess 2:05pm. 


NEXT:   Preliminary Hearing on May 26th at 3:00pm. (Case #15CF64 involves a Co-Defendant which is set on this same date/time)

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon S Topel
Current: 31 Madison Avenue, Milton, WI 53563 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2015)
Prior: 405 County Rd. M, Whitewater, WI 53190
Duplicate original warrant returned//def in custody

[MK] case called at 3:53pm. 
Defendant Alyssa A Wutke in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms. Wutke indicates that her address is:  W9405 W. Townline Road, Whitewater
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint to support Counts #2 and #3. 
Ms. Wutke verifies that she heard and understood the information the Court provided on right to counsel, and that constructive waiver of counsel warnings were given
.
After Ms. Wutke indicates that she wishes to be represented by counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 
The Court requires Ms. Wutke to go to the Jefferson Public Defender's Office this afternoon to make arrangements to apply for Public Defender representation

The Court requires a $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at the Walmart in Jefferson
--no contact with Brandon Topel
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
--to go to the Jefferson Public Defender's Office this afternoon to make arrangements to apply for Public Defender representation

At 4:03pm the Court also calls the Co-Defendant's Case #15CF64, State -v- Brandon S. Topel.  
Co-Defendant Brandon Topel does not appear. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint to support Count #1.
The Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant for the arrest of Brandon S. Topel in Case #15CF64.  The Warrant is to be body-only, with no geographic restrictions. 
recess 
4:07pm. 

NEXT:  On #15CF65: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 4/28/15 at 2:00pm.;  On #15CF64: Warrant pends
